```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(nycflights13)
knitr::opts_chunk$set(cache = TRUE)
```


## Combined

```{r}
filter(
  flights,
  arr_time >= 2200,
  carrier == "UA",
  arr_delay > 120,
  dest != "HNL"
)
```


Alternative variant:

```{r}
filter(
  flights,
  arr_time >= 2200 &
    carrier == "UA" &
    arr_delay > 120 &
    dest != "HNL"
)

```

## Intermediate variables

Naming is hard!

```{r}
late_flights <- filter(flights, arr_time >= 2200)
late_ua_flights <- filter(late_flights, carrier == "UA")
late_late_ua_flights <- filter(late_ua_flights, arr_delay > 120)
late_late_ua_flights_not_honolulu <- filter(late_late_ua_flights, dest != "HNL")
late_late_ua_flights_not_honolulu
```

## Nested expressions

Difficult to read.

```{r}
filter(
  filter(
    filter(
      filter(
        flights,
        arr_time >= 2200
      ),
      carrier == "UA"
    ),
    arr_delay > 120
  ),
  dest != "HNL"
)
```

## Pipe

```{r}
flights %>% 
  filter(arr_time >= 2200) %>% 
  filter(carrier == "UA") %>% 
  filter(arr_delay > 120) %>% 
  filter(dest != "HNL")
```

Two options for assigning the result of a pipe to a variable:

```{r}
late_late_ua_flights_not_honolulu <-
  flights %>% 
  filter(arr_time >= 2200) %>% 
  filter(carrier == "UA") %>% 
  filter(arr_delay > 120) %>% 
  filter(dest != "HNL")
```

```{r}
flights %>% 
  filter(arr_time >= 2200) %>% 
  filter(carrier == "UA") %>% 
  filter(arr_delay > 120) %>% 
  filter(dest != "HNL") ->
  late_late_ua_flights_not_honolulu
```
